intro: Rochelia macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered rochelia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound umbels of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant features finely divided, feather-like leaves that are often aromatic. It is native to regions of eastern North America, particularly in moist, open habitats. Rochelia macrocalyx is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
